title: Creates new classification of persistent misdemeanor offender for the purposes of sentencing, and prescribes the sentence therefor
summary: Creates new classification of "persistent misdemeanor offender" for the purposes of sentencing a person convicted of a misdemeanor after having been convicted of five or more crimes within the last five years, and prescribes that the sentence therefor shall include a mandatory definite sentence of imprisonment of no less than thirty days and no more than one year.

       Introduced  by  Sens.  GOLDEN, DeFRANCISCO, JOHNSON, RANZENHOFER -- read
         twice and ordered printed, and when printed to  be  committed  to  the
         Committee on Codes

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  penal  law  and  the criminal procedure law, in
         relation to sentence for persistent misdemeanor offenders

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The penal law is amended by adding a new section 70.16 to
    2  read as follows:
    3  S 70.16 SENTENCE OF IMPRISONMENT FOR PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR OFFENDER.
    4    1. DEFINITION OF PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR OFFENDER.
    5    (A) A PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR OFFENDER IS A PERSON WHO STANDS CONVICTED
    6  OF A MISDEMEANOR AFTER HAVING PREVIOUSLY BEEN CONVICTED OF FIVE OR  MORE
    7  CRIMES, AS PROVIDED IN PARAGRAPH (B) OF THIS SUBDIVISION.
    8    (B) A PREVIOUS CRIMINAL CONVICTION WITHIN THE MEANING OF PARAGRAPH (A)
    9  OF THIS SUBDIVISION IS A CONVICTION OF A CRIME IN THIS STATE, PROVIDED:
   10    (I) THAT A SENTENCE FOR SUCH CONVICTION WAS IMPOSED THEREFOR; AND
   11    (II) THAT THE DEFENDANT WAS SENTENCED FOR SUCH CONVICTION PRIOR TO THE
   12  DATE OF COMMISSION OF THE PRESENT MISDEMEANOR; AND
   13    (III)  SUBJECT  TO  THE  PERIOD  OF  TIME  EXCLUDED  PURSUANT  TO  THE
   14  PROVISIONS OF PARAGRAPH (C) OF THIS SUBDIVISION, THAT THE DEFENDANT  WAS
   15  SENTENCED  FOR SUCH CONVICTION NO MORE THAN FIVE YEARS PRIOR TO THE DATE
   16  OF COMMISSION OF THE PRESENT MISDEMEANOR; AND
   17    (IV) THAT THE DEFENDANT WAS NOT PARDONED ON THE GROUNDS OF INNOCENCE.
   18    (C) ANY PERIOD OF TIME DURING WHICH THE DEFENDANT WAS INCARCERATED FOR
   19  ANY REASON BETWEEN THE DATE OF COMMISSION OF THE PREVIOUS CRIME AND  THE
   20  DATE  OF  COMMISSION  OF THE PRESENT MISDEMEANOR SHALL NOT COUNT AS TIME
   21  WHICH HAS ELAPSED IN DETERMINING THE FIVE YEAR PERIOD WITHIN  WHICH  THE
   22  DEFENDANT MUST HAVE BEEN SENTENCED FOR THE PREVIOUS CRIME UNDER SUBPARA-
   23  GRAPH  (III) OF PARAGRAPH (B) OF THIS SUBDIVISION; SUCH FIVE YEAR PERIOD

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04233-01-1

       S. 643                              2

    1  SHALL BE EXTENDED BY SUCH PERIOD OR PERIODS OF TIME SERVED IN INCARCERA-
    2  TION.
    3    (D) THE TERM "SENTENCE", WHEN REFERRING TO THE SENTENCE FOR A PREVIOUS
    4  CRIMINAL CONVICTION WITHIN THE MEANING OF PARAGRAPH (B) OF THIS SUBDIVI-
    5  SION,  SHALL  INCLUDE  BUT  NOT  BE  LIMITED TO: A SUSPENDED SENTENCE; A
    6  SUSPENDED EXECUTION OF SENTENCE; A SENTENCE OF PROBATION; A SENTENCE  OF
    7  CONDITIONAL  DISCHARGE  OR  OF  UNCONDITIONAL  DISCHARGE;  A SENTENCE OF
    8  CERTIFICATION TO THE CARE AND CUSTODY OF THE OFFICE  OF  ALCOHOLISM  AND
    9  SUBSTANCE  ABUSE  SERVICES;  OR  A SENTENCE OF ANY COMBINATION OF ONE OR
   10  MORE OF THE FOREGOING SENTENCES.
   11    2. AUTHORIZED SENTENCE. WHEN THE COURT  HAS  FOUND,  PURSUANT  TO  THE
   12  PROVISIONS  OF THE CRIMINAL PROCEDURE LAW, THAT A PERSON IS A PERSISTENT
   13  MISDEMEANOR OFFENDER, THE COURT  MUST  IMPOSE  A  DEFINITE  SENTENCE  OF
   14  IMPRISONMENT,  THE  TERM OF WHICH SHALL BE FIXED BY THE COURT AT NO LESS
   15  THAN THIRTY DAYS AND NO MORE THAN ONE YEAR, AND MAY IMPOSE ANY  SENTENCE
   16  AUTHORIZED  BY LAW OTHER THAN AND IN ADDITION TO SUCH SENTENCE OF IMPRI-
   17  SONMENT. IN FIXING THE LENGTH OF THE TERM OF  SUCH  DEFINITE  PERIOD  OF
   18  IMPRISONMENT TO WHICH THE COURT MUST SENTENCE THE DEFENDANT UPON A FIND-
   19  ING  THAT  SUCH  PERSON  IS A PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR OFFENDER, THE COURT
   20  SHALL CONSIDER THE HISTORY AND CHARACTER OF THE DEFENDANT AND THE NATURE
   21  AND CIRCUMSTANCES OF SUCH PERSON'S CRIMINAL CONDUCT AND  SHALL  SENTENCE
   22  THE DEFENDANT TO A TERM HAVING A LENGTH, WITHIN THE FOREGOING PRESCRIBED
   23  LIMITS, THAT WILL BEST SERVE THE PUBLIC INTEREST.
   24    S  2.  The  criminal  procedure law is amended by adding a new section
   25  400.14 to read as follows:
   26  S  400.14    PROCEDURE  FOR  DETERMINING  WHETHER  DEFENDANT  SHOULD  BE
   27                 SENTENCED AS A PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR OFFENDER.
   28    1.  APPLICABILITY. THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION GOVERN THE PROCEDURE
   29  THAT MUST BE FOLLOWED IN ORDER  TO  IMPOSE  THE  PERSISTENT  MISDEMEANOR
   30  OFFENDER  SENTENCE AUTHORIZED BY SUBDIVISION TWO OF SECTION 70.16 OF THE
   31  PENAL LAW. SUCH SENTENCE MAY NOT BE IMPOSED UNLESS, BASED UPON  EVIDENCE
   32  IN  THE RECORD OF A HEARING HELD PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION, THE COURT (A)
   33  HAS FOUND THAT THE DEFENDANT IS A  PERSISTENT  MISDEMEANOR  OFFENDER  AS
   34  DEFINED  IN  SUBDIVISION  ONE OF SECTION 70.16 OF THE PENAL LAW, AND (B)
   35  HAS CONSIDERED THE HISTORY AND CHARACTER OF THE DEFENDANT AND THE NATURE
   36  AND CIRCUMSTANCES OF HIS OR HER CRIMINAL CONDUCT, AS WELL AS THE  PUBLIC
   37  INTEREST,  IN  DETERMINING  THE  LENGTH  OF  THE DEFINITE SENTENCE TO BE
   38  IMPOSED WITHIN THE LIMITS PRESCRIBED BY SUBDIVISION TWO OF SECTION 70.16
   39  OF THE PENAL LAW.
   40    2. AUTHORIZATION FOR HEARING. WHEN INFORMATION AVAILABLE TO THE  COURT
   41  PRIOR  TO SENTENCING INDICATES THAT THE DEFENDANT IS A PERSISTENT MISDE-
   42  MEANOR OFFENDER, AND WHEN, IN THE OPINION OF THE  COURT,  THE  AVAILABLE
   43  INFORMATION SHOWS THAT A PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR OFFENDER SENTENCE MAY BE
   44  WARRANTED,  THE  COURT  MAY ORDER A HEARING TO DETERMINE (A) WHETHER THE
   45  DEFENDANT IS IN FACT A PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR OFFENDER, AND (B)  IF  SO,
   46  WHETHER A PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR OFFENDER SENTENCE SHOULD BE IMPOSED.
   47    3.  ORDER  DIRECTING A HEARING. AN ORDER DIRECTING A HEARING TO DETER-
   48  MINE WHETHER THE DEFENDANT SHOULD BE SENTENCED AS A PERSISTENT MISDEMEA-
   49  NOR OFFENDER MUST BE FILED WITH THE CLERK OF THE COURT AND MUST  SPECIFY
   50  A DATE FOR THE HEARING NOT LESS THAN TWENTY DAYS FROM THE DATE THE ORDER
   51  IS  FILED.  THE  COURT MUST ANNEX TO AND FILE WITH THE ORDER A STATEMENT
   52  SETTING FORTH THE FOLLOWING:
   53    (A) THE DATES AND PLACES OF THE PREVIOUS CONVICTIONS WHICH RENDER  THE
   54  DEFENDANT  A  PERSISTENT  MISDEMEANOR OFFENDER AS DEFINED IN SUBDIVISION
   55  ONE OF SECTION 70.16 OF THE PENAL LAW; AND

       S. 643                              3

    1    (B) THE FACTORS IN  THE  DEFENDANT'S  BACKGROUND  AND  PRIOR  CRIMINAL
    2  CONDUCT,  AS WELL AS THE PUBLIC INTEREST, WHICH THE COURT DEEMS RELEVANT
    3  FOR THE PURPOSE OF SENTENCING THE DEFENDANT AS A PERSISTENT  MISDEMEANOR
    4  OFFENDER.
    5    4.  NOTICE  OF HEARING. UPON RECEIPT OF THE ORDER AND STATEMENT OF THE
    6  COURT, THE CLERK OF THE COURT MUST SEND  A  NOTICE  OF  HEARING  TO  THE
    7  DEFENDANT,  HIS  OR  HER  COUNSEL AND THE DISTRICT ATTORNEY. SUCH NOTICE
    8  MUST SPECIFY THE TIME AND PLACE OF THE HEARING AND  THE  FACT  THAT  THE
    9  PURPOSE  OF  THE  HEARING  IS  TO DETERMINE WHETHER OR NOT THE DEFENDANT
   10  SHOULD BE SENTENCED AS A PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR  OFFENDER.  EACH  NOTICE
   11  REQUIRED  TO  BE  SENT  HEREUNDER  MUST  BE ACCOMPANIED BY A COPY OF THE
   12  STATEMENT OF THE COURT.
   13    5. BURDEN AND STANDARD OF  PROOF;  EVIDENCE.  UPON  ANY  HEARING  HELD
   14  PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION THE BURDEN OF PROOF IS UPON THE PEOPLE. A FIND-
   15  ING  THAT THE DEFENDANT IS A PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR OFFENDER, AS DEFINED
   16  IN SUBDIVISION ONE OF SECTION 70.16 OF THE PENAL LAW, MUST BE BASED UPON
   17  PROOF BEYOND A REASONABLE DOUBT BY EVIDENCE ADMISSIBLE UNDER  THE  RULES
   18  APPLICABLE TO THE TRIAL OF THE ISSUE OF GUILT. MATTERS PERTAINING TO THE
   19  DEFENDANT'S  HISTORY  AND  CHARACTER AND THE NATURE AND CIRCUMSTANCES OF
   20  HIS OR HER CRIMINAL CONDUCT, AS WELL AS  THE  PUBLIC  INTEREST,  MAY  BE
   21  ESTABLISHED BY ANY RELEVANT EVIDENCE, NOT LEGALLY PRIVILEGED, REGARDLESS
   22  OF ADMISSIBILITY UNDER THE EXCLUSIONARY RULES OF EVIDENCE, AND THE STAN-
   23  DARD  OF  PROOF WITH RESPECT TO SUCH MATTERS SHALL BE A PREPONDERANCE OF
   24  THE EVIDENCE.
   25    6. CONSTITUTIONALITY OF PRIOR CONVICTIONS. A  PREVIOUS  CONVICTION  IN
   26  THIS  OR  ANY  OTHER JURISDICTION WHICH WAS OBTAINED IN VIOLATION OF THE
   27  RIGHTS OF THE DEFENDANT UNDER THE APPLICABLE PROVISIONS OF THE CONSTITU-
   28  TION OF THE UNITED STATES MAY NOT BE COUNTED IN DETERMINING WHETHER  THE
   29  DEFENDANT  IS  A  PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR OFFENDER. THE DEFENDANT MAY, AT
   30  ANY TIME DURING THE COURSE OF THE HEARING HEREUNDER CONTROVERT AN  ALLE-
   31  GATION  WITH RESPECT TO SUCH CONVICTION IN THE STATEMENT OF THE COURT ON
   32  THE GROUNDS THAT THE CONVICTION WAS UNCONSTITUTIONALLY OBTAINED.   FAIL-
   33  URE  TO  CHALLENGE THE PREVIOUS CONVICTION IN THE MANNER PROVIDED HEREIN
   34  CONSTITUTES A WAIVER ON THE PART OF THE DEFENDANT OF ANY  ALLEGATION  OF
   35  UNCONSTITUTIONALITY  UNLESS GOOD CAUSE BE SHOWN FOR SUCH FAILURE TO MAKE
   36  TIMELY CHALLENGE.
   37    7. PRELIMINARY EXAMINATION. WHEN THE DEFENDANT APPEARS FOR THE HEARING
   38  THE COURT MUST ASK HIM OR HER WHETHER HE OR SHE WISHES TO CONTROVERT ANY
   39  ALLEGATION MADE IN THE STATEMENT PREPARED BY THE COURT, AND  WHETHER  HE
   40  OR SHE WISHES TO PRESENT EVIDENCE ON THE ISSUE OF WHETHER HE OR SHE IS A
   41  PERSISTENT  MISDEMEANOR  OFFENDER OR ON THE QUESTION OF HIS OR HER BACK-
   42  GROUND AND CRIMINAL CONDUCT. IF THE DEFENDANT WISHES TO  CONTROVERT  ANY
   43  ALLEGATION  IN  THE  STATEMENT  OF THE COURT, HE OR SHE MUST SPECIFY THE
   44  PARTICULAR ALLEGATION OR ALLEGATIONS HE OR SHE WISHES TO CONTROVERT.  IF
   45  HE OR SHE WISHES TO PRESENT EVIDENCE IN HIS OR HER OWN BEHALF, HE OR SHE
   46  MUST  SPECIFY THE NATURE OF SUCH EVIDENCE. UNCONTROVERTED ALLEGATIONS IN
   47  THE STATEMENT OF THE COURT ARE DEEMED EVIDENCE IN THE RECORD.
   48    8. CASES WHERE FURTHER HEARING IS NOT REQUIRED.  WHERE  THE  UNCONTRO-
   49  VERTED  ALLEGATIONS  IN  THE  STATEMENT  OF  THE COURT ARE SUFFICIENT TO
   50  SUPPORT A FINDING THAT THE DEFENDANT IS A PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR  OFFEN-
   51  DER  AND  THE COURT IS SATISFIED THAT (A) THE UNCONTROVERTED ALLEGATIONS
   52  WITH RESPECT TO THE DEFENDANT'S BACKGROUND AND THE NATURE OF HIS OR  HER
   53  PRIOR CRIMINAL CONDUCT, AS WELL AS THE PUBLIC INTEREST, WARRANT SENTENC-
   54  ING  THE  DEFENDANT  AS  A  PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR OFFENDER, AND (B) THE
   55  DEFENDANT EITHER HAS NO RELEVANT EVIDENCE TO PRESENT OR THE FACTS  WHICH
   56  COULD BE ESTABLISHED THROUGH THE EVIDENCE OFFERED BY THE DEFENDANT WOULD

       S. 643                              4

    1  NOT  AFFECT THE COURT'S DECISION, THE COURT MAY ENTER A FINDING THAT THE
    2  DEFENDANT IS A PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR OFFENDER AND SENTENCE HIM  OR  HER
    3  IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF SUBDIVISION TWO OF SECTION 70.16 OF
    4  THE PENAL LAW.
    5    9.  CASES  WHERE  FURTHER  HEARING  IS  REQUIRED.  WHERE THE DEFENDANT
    6  CONTROVERTS AN ALLEGATION IN THE STATEMENT OF THE COURT AND  THE  UNCON-
    7  TROVERTED  ALLEGATIONS IN SUCH STATEMENT ARE NOT SUFFICIENT TO SUPPORT A
    8  FINDING THAT THE DEFENDANT  IS  A  PERSISTENT  MISDEMEANOR  OFFENDER  AS
    9  DEFINED  IN  SUBDIVISION ONE OF SECTION 70.16 OF THE PENAL LAW, OR WHERE
   10  THE UNCONTROVERTED ALLEGATIONS WITH RESPECT TO THE  DEFENDANT'S  HISTORY
   11  AND  THE  NATURE  OF  HIS  OR HER PRIOR CRIMINAL CONDUCT, AS WELL AS THE
   12  PUBLIC INTEREST, WARRANT SENTENCING HIM OR  HER  TO  A  LESSER  TERM  OF
   13  IMPRISONMENT  AS  A  PERSISTENT  MISDEMEANOR  OFFENDER,  WITHIN THE TERM
   14  LIMITS PRESCRIBED BY LAW, OR WHERE THE DEFENDANT HAS OFFERED TO  PRESENT
   15  EVIDENCE  TO  ESTABLISH  FACTS THAT WOULD AFFECT THE COURT'S DECISION ON
   16  THE QUESTION OF WHETHER A PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR  OFFENDER  SENTENCE  IS
   17  WARRANTED, THE COURT MAY FIX A DATE FOR A FURTHER HEARING.  SUCH HEARING
   18  SHALL  BE BEFORE THE COURT WITHOUT A JURY AND EITHER PARTY MAY INTRODUCE
   19  EVIDENCE WITH RESPECT TO  THE  CONTROVERTED  ALLEGATIONS  OR  ANY  OTHER
   20  MATTER  RELEVANT  TO THE ISSUE OF WHETHER OR NOT THE DEFENDANT SHOULD BE
   21  SENTENCED AS A PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR OFFENDER AND ON THE ISSUE  OF  THE
   22  LENGTH  OF  SUCH  SENTENCE.   AT THE CONCLUSION OF THE HEARING THE COURT
   23  MUST MAKE A FINDING AS TO WHETHER OR NOT THE DEFENDANT IS  A  PERSISTENT
   24  MISDEMEANOR  OFFENDER  AND,  UPON A FINDING THAT HE OR SHE IS SUCH, MUST
   25  THEN MAKE SUCH FINDINGS OF FACT AS IT DEEMS RELEVANT TO THE QUESTION  OF
   26  WHAT LENGTH OF PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR OFFENDER INCARCERATION SENTENCE IS
   27  WARRANTED,  AND WHAT OTHER SENTENCE AUTHORIZED BY LAW SHOULD BE IMPOSED.
   28  IF THE COURT FINDS THAT THE DEFENDANT IS A PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR OFFEN-
   29  DER, IT MAY SENTENCE THE DEFENDANT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS  OF
   30  SUBDIVISION TWO OF SECTION 70.16 OF THE PENAL LAW.
   31    10. TERMINATION OF HEARING. AT ANY TIME DURING THE PENDENCY OF A HEAR-
   32  ING  PURSUANT  TO THIS SECTION, THE COURT MAY, IN ITS DISCRETION, TERMI-
   33  NATE THE HEARING WITHOUT MAKING ANY FINDING.  IN SUCH CASE,  UNLESS  THE
   34  COURT  RECOMMENCES THE PROCEEDINGS AND MAKES THE NECESSARY FINDINGS, THE
   35  DEFENDANT MAY NOT BE SENTENCED AS A PERSISTENT MISDEMEANOR OFFENDER.
   36    S 3. This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeed-
   37  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law and the criminal procedure law, in relation to sentence for persistent misdemeanor offenders
